title: 110_s3614
content: The Act may be cited as the "National Hunger Relief Act of 2008" and includes provisions related to nutrition programs. The "National Hunger Relief Act of 2008" includes provisions amending the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program by redefining the term "thrifty food plan" and making adjustments to the cost of the diet described. The "National Hunger Relief Act of 2008" includes provisions to adjust the cost of the diet for the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program based on percentages of the cost in preceding years, with rounding to the nearest higher dollar increment for each household size. The National Hunger Relief Act of 2008 adjusts the cost of the diet for the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program annually based on the cost in the preceding June, rounding to the nearest higher dollar increment for each household size. Amendments are made to sections of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 to reflect these changes. SEC. 3. SCHOOL MEALS. The Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act is amended to adjust the value of food assistance for each meal based on the annual percentage change in the Price Index for Foods Used in Schools and Institutions. The Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act is amended to adjust the value of food assistance for each meal based on the annual percentage change in the Price Index for Foods Used in Schools and Institutions. The amendment includes adjustments for March, April, and May each year, rounding the result to the nearest higher 1/4 cent. The Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act is amended to adjust food assistance values semiannually based on the Price Index for Foods Used in Schools and Institutions. Payment rates are rounded on January 1 and July 1 each year. The national average payment rates for meals and supplements are increased to the nearest higher cent on July 1, based on the unrounded amount previously in effect. The Secretary adjusts amounts specified in subparagraph (A) on each January 1 to reflect changes for the 6-month period ending the preceding November 30. The national average payment rates for meals and supplements are increased on July 1 and January 1 based on changes in the Consumer Price Index for food away from home. The increases are calculated using unrounded amounts previously in effect. The reimbursement factors for Family or Group Day Care Home Sponsoring Organizations are adjusted on July 1 and January 1 to reflect changes in the Consumer Price Index. The increases are rounded to the nearest higher cent increment. The Consumer Price Index for food at home is used to adjust reimbursement factors for Family or Group Day Care Home Sponsoring Organizations. Increases are rounded to the nearest higher cent increment. The Secretary adjusts reimbursement factors for Family or Group Day Care Home Sponsoring Organizations based on changes in the Consumer Price Index for food at home every July 1 and January 1. Increases are rounded to the nearest higher cent increment. The Special Milk Program under the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 is amended to ensure a minimum rate of reimbursement for milk served in schools and eligible institutions. The reimbursement rate is adjusted semiannually based on changes in the Producer Price Index for Fresh Processed Milk. The amendments made by this Act take effect on October 1, 2008.
